title: How to Turn Off Earth City Lights in Google Earth

steps.headline: Open Google Earth.Wait for the Google Earth service to to initialize and self-login (no Google login required).
Look down towards the bottom left hand corner of the screen for an area called "Layer".
steps.description: Scroll through the "Layer" list until you come to a "Gallery" option. Click the "+" icon that is to the left of the word. This should open a drop-down list.

steps.headline: Scroll through the list to find "NASA".
steps.description: Click the + button to the left of it's name.

steps.headline: Scroll through the list and find "Earth City Lights".
steps.description: Again, click the "+" icon. (On most recent updates of Google Earth, this should automatically expand by default.)

steps.headline: Click the radio-checkbox to the left of "Information" to turn this feature off.

tyn: Internet access (it won't work without it)
text: Open Google Earth.Wait for the Google Earth service to to initialize and self-login (no Google login required).  Look down towards the bottom left hand corner of the screen for an area called "Layer". Scroll through the "Layer" list until you come to a "Gallery" option. Click the "+" icon that is to the left of the word. This should open a drop-down list. Scroll through the list to find "NASA". Click the + button to the left of it's name. Scroll through the list and find "Earth City Lights". Again, click the "+" icon. (On most recent updates of Google Earth, this should automatically expand by default.) Click the radio-checkbox to the left of "Information" to turn this feature off.
sentences: Open Google Earth.Wait for the Google Earth service to to initialize and self-login (no Google login required).
Look down towards the bottom left hand corner of the screen for an area called "Layer".
Scroll through the "Layer" list until you come to a "Gallery" option.
Click the "+" icon that is to the left of the word.
This should open a drop-down list.
Scroll through the list to find "NASA".
Click the + button to the left of it's name.
Scroll through the list and find "Earth City Lights".
(On most recent updates of Google Earth, this should automatically expand by default.)
Click the radio-checkbox to the left of "Information" to turn this feature off.
